intro: Didymocarpus fimbrisepalus, commonly known as the hairy-fruited ironwood, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, fibrous wood and hairy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by dark, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland evergreen forests. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
